people: Prince Andrew, the Duke of York

relationships.description: Goldberger is identified as Epstein's attorney
Mackenzie is the Interviews Editor for the Today Programme
Mentioned together in circulating stories in UK press

analysis.purpose: To request an interview with Jeffrey Epstein through his attorney regarding stories circulating about Epstein and Prince Andrew
analysis.significance: Shows media interest in Epstein's connections to Prince Andrew and attempts to get Epstein's side of the story amid UK press coverage

notable_quotes: We are keen to explore the possibility of conducting an interview with Mr Epstein, on the subject of the stories which are circulating, however inaccurately, about both him and Prince Andrew, the Duke of York
The combination of these outlets means the global 'reach' of a BBC Today programme interview is second to none

We are a programme that carries considerable weight and influence and which prides itself in being a first port of call for many of the most important and influential figures on the international stage
red_flags: Media interest in Epstein-Prince Andrew relationship stories

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is a standard media interview request

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is a media interview request forwarded to Epstein

details: Reference to speculative reporting in UK press about Epstein and Prince Andrew

public_knowledge.context: This reflects media interest in the Epstein-Prince Andrew relationship that was already circulating in UK press by 2011

analysis.summary: BBC Today Programme Interviews Editor Kirsty Mackenzie requests an interview with Jeffrey Epstein through his attorney Jack Goldberger to address stories circulating in the UK press about Epstein and Prince Andrew, highlighting the program's significant influence and global reach.
